climbs.name: Skull Poke
climbs.fa: George Armstrong, Brad Schwartz and Chris Miller, January 1993

content.description: Start up a ramp to access a right-slanting crack in a corner.
content.location:
Located 15 feet right of

Desiderious' Delight

on the east face.

climbs.name: Quaking Has-Beens
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger and Rich Perch, November 1988

content.description: This route is on the south face of the formation and climbs featured gray patina rock past three bolts. You can place a small cam before the first bolt and another one between the third bolt and the top. There is a two bolt anchor on the top to belay/rappel from.
content.protection:
3 bolts, plus some stoppers and cams up to 1.5 inches, bolted anchor rap

(all bolts 1/2" SS)
content.location: On the south side of the formation. Look for the first bolt 12’-15’ above the ground.

climbs.name: Desiderious' Delight
climbs.fa: Don O'Kelley and Dave Davis, April 1969

content.description:
Climbs an easy crack that is just left of a recessed area.

Named for Desiderious Erasmus Roterodamus (October 28, 1466 – July 12, 1536) who wrote, among other works,

In Praise of Folly

.
content.location:
Located 15 feet right of

Quaking Has-Beens

on the southeast corner.
